fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-691].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new metric for SLA through a Custom Select List (Cascading) field. 
!sla_2.jpg|thumbnail!
!sla_1.jpg|thumbnail!
# Create a new ticket which is subjected to SLA
!sla_3.jpg|thumbnail!
# As expected, it should show up the SLA on the right corner
!sla_4.jpg|thumbnail!
# Resolve the ticket
!sla_5.jpg|thumbnail!
# After the ticket has been resolved, *Edit* the ticket and change it to a Non- SLA metric
!sla_6.jpg|thumbnail!

Result:
It is still showing the SLA on the right corner, though it has been modified to a non SLA metric.
!sla_7.jpg|thumbnail!

Expected Behaviour:
Even the ticket has already been resolved and yet modified to a non SLA metric, it should respect the JQL and the SLA should not display.
fields.summary: SLA still showing up when issue has been modified to a Non-SLA value after Closing
error in creating issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-668].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of Issue

When the SLAs are set in such a way that there will be a clash between the condition and definition, the SLAs would not work properly

h3. Steps to reproduce

In the scenario that I met, this was the following situation :

# Set up the SLA for a certain Service Desk to be the following :
#* Stop on Resolution Set
#* SLA would no longer show up in the issue if the issue reached the Resolved status
!SLA1.png|thumbnail!
!SLA2.png|thumbnail!
# Resolve a ticket within that Service Desk, so that the SLAs would no longer show :
!SLA3.png|thumbnail!
# Reopen the ticket. The SLA should now show, but is no longer showing :
!SLA4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SLAs will not work properly if there is a clash between the conditions and definitions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-667].
  {panel}

Hi, we have an issue about our jira servicedesk knowledge base. It can be linked to a confluence space without any issue. In Service desk homepage, after entering some characters in search field, all related pages can be displayed, but when clicking any result page, it will display a blank page. See attached images.

Our environment is as below:
Jira: 6.1.3
Confluence: 5.3.4
ServiceDesk:1.2.6.1
fields.summary: Jira servicedesk knowledge base displaying a blank page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-659].
  {panel}

h5.summary
In Customer Portal, all fields of the "Labels" type will get suggestions from the default _Labels_ field.

h5.steps to reproduce
# create a Custom Field of the "Labels" type;
# add the new field to a Customer Portal form;
# create an issue (either in Customer Portal or base JIRA):
#* populate the custom label field;
#* populate the default _Labels_ field with different values.
# attempt to create a new issue in Customer Portal and see suggestions available for both fields.

*Expected result:* suggestions match existing values for each field.
*Actual result:* all suggestions are existing values for the default _Labels_ field.

This only affects the Customer Portal forms, in JIRA views fields are behaving as expected.

h5.workaround
# Update the labels manually in JIRA Issue View.
# Create a dummy issue and maintain the list of values to be suggested in its default _Labels_ field.
fields.summary: Incorrect suggestions for labels fields in Customer Request form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-648].
  {panel}

Every user who creates a Service Desk request is automatically being added to the "Users" column in Service Desk. To think that they are already members of the group specified on the "Groups" column.
!sd_1.jpg|thumbnail!
!sd_2.jpg|thumbnail!

Significance:
If the company has more than a thousand users, this "Users" column will be flooded by the names of the users who submitted a Service Desk request.
fields.summary: Users creating a Service Desk Request are automatically added on the "Users" column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-647].
  {panel}

JIRA OnDemand:

We have this problem:
Now, the Notifications settings for Jira Service Desk at the system is disable.
We use the JIRA notification scheme associated with the Project.
For example, when a problem is resolved, the notification arrive the mail queue, but when the message is sent automatically this does not arrive the receiver. Only the Created Issue notification arrive correctly.
Before, we had the Notifications settings for JIRA Service Desk activate, and all users received the emails correctly.

Please, do you can help?
fields.summary: Problem for send email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-645].
  {panel}

I know that a lot of people have mentioned either allowing multiple projects per service desk.   

As a cheap, relatively easy fix, could we add a static link feature to the 'Request Types' in the Customer Portal?  

Example:  
Technical Desk
 - Server Support
 - Program Support
 - Bug Report
 - Sales Support (This could be a hyperlink to one of our other Service Desks)


I think this is a relatively quick work around that would allow customers to seamlessly integrate Service Desks.  Also it would allow direct links to other areas if necessary.
fields.summary: Allow addition of static links in Request Types
default group on service desk's project roles

Dear support,

I have run into bug when exporting SLA’s in excel https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-149.

Export to word is not much more useful.

Im not able to find version we use ( https://servicedeskixor.atlassian.net)
When will be this bug fixed or is there a workaround available?
We will re-evaluate usage of Jira service desk ( as we use trial now ) based on your feedback, as reporting is quite crucial for us and our clients.

Thanks in advance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-637].
  {panel}

Hi,

I updated the plugin to 1.2.6.1 last Friday on our jira. In notification scheme of a project, only assignee should get email. Also I have disabled "SEND_EMAIL_NOTIFICATIONS" in db table AO_54307E_VIEWPORT of the project.

While the issue is after the updating, reporters keep getting emails from the service desk. 

Now I disabled two modules notifications-soy & notification-filter-impl of the plugin and reporters don't get any email any more.

Is it correct way to disable reporter notification? I think assignee will not get any notification if I disabled the two modules. 

Is there any other better way to do this?

Thanks in advance
Hailin
fields.summary: Disable reporter Notification of version Service Desk  1.2.6.1

fields.description:
{panel:title=Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
 At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html]. 
{panel}
{panel:title=Update as of 13 September 2021}
Hello all,

Thank you for your patience. I apologise, it has been too long since I have provided an update for this feature request.

The bad news is that it has taken longer than expected to line up the necessary dependencies to deliver this capability. It is on its way, but we do not expect to be able to deliver it until mid 2022.

In the meanwhile we are working on some steps along the way that simplify customer access. Most notably helping internal customers (e.g. employees) sign-up to the help centre based on site access domain settings, and applying restrictions to external customer sign-up based on email domain (JSDCLOUD-868).

To help guide our focus on Customer Management in JSM, I have prepared a short survey (10 questions), to get a better sense of how you manage customers in your organisation. I would greatly appreciate your feedback - https://forms.gle/27CBCUC5akpgwwAL8.

Kind regards,

Ben.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently it is not possible to integrate sso with JIRA Service Desk, it would be better if can provide this functionality so that customer does not need to sign in to the customer service portal in order to raise a request.
h3. Workaround

If the customer (portal-only user) has an email address verified with [Atlassian Access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html], site-admin can migrate the account to Atlassian account so that the customer can login with SSO.
 Once migrated, ensure that the site access is enabled and ensure that there is no application access. This will ensure that there are no license consumed and have the users treated as a customer.

!Screenshot 2019-10-29 14.00.22.png|thumbnail! !Screenshot 2019-10-29 14.11.20.png|thumbnail! !site access.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SSO integration with JIRA Service Desk
Make some classes exported from OSGi container
Provide events for SLA configuration changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-625].
  {panel}

Follow up to the original issue: JSD-95

h6. Problem
With the fix in JSD-95, Service Desk detects new tickets when the "Issue Created Event" is triggered during the clone operation. If this event is removed from the workflow, then Service Desk does not reset the SLA.

h6. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a new Service Desk Project
* Modify the "Create" transition of the related workflow and remove the "Issue Created Event"
* Publish the workflow
* Create a new Service Desk Request
* Wait a bit for the SLA to count down
* Clone the issue
* SLA is not reset

h6. Workaround
* Ensure that the "Create Issue Event" is part of the workflow's Create transition
fields.summary: Clone Issue does not reset SLA if Issue Created Event is not triggered
Tab in Request Form

        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.start(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:76)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.contextInitialized(LauncherContextListener.java:54)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4939)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.startInternal(StandardContext.java:5434)
        at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:150)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1559)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1549)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
{code}

After I've bounced Jira again, I was able login to Jira Admin, i've started re-index but it failed with the same exception 
"com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$BlankStringArgumentException: names[0] should not be empty!"
I've bounced jira service again and then all issues from the existed project were wiped.
fields.summary: Jira thrown an exception during start and failed to operate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-612].
  {panel}

When you change the configuration of the SLA then Service Desk does not "rewrite history". This means if it is changed it may not affect previous issues. For example:

* JSP-1 and JSP-2 are raised.
* The SLA is changed. JSP-1 does not appear to be updated.

When the re-calculate SLA code runs after an SLA config change it sees that and deems JSP-1 as not ongoing and hence it does not "re-invent" that JSP-1 met SLA under the new rules.  Instead it clears that SLA was ever met.

Now why does it do that?  

Well its because the semantics of re-writing SLA history is complicated and invokes existential dilemmas that only the like of Emmanuelle Kant, Renee Descartes and [~miruflin] can answer. So instead of pretending that SLA where met or not met, SD decides they never existed. We could do a better job in informing the user of the impact of the SLA change at the time of the change and have raised issue JSD-494 for this.

At the minimum please enhance the product so that it warns users about this.
fields.summary: Enhance JIRA Service Desk so that it provides better support for SLA changes
Make it easier for Service Desk team members to attach customer-visible files to a ticket

  {panel}

Step to reproduce:
# install JIRA Service Desk plugin version 1.2.5
# create Select List type custom field
# add 3000 options to the custom field
# use IE9, IE10 or IE11 and try to create issue from the Service Desk UI
# (Bug) in the Select List, try to find any option and it load very slowly. Eg: when searching for option "WST1234" , type "WST" in the Select List field and it will take more than 15 seconds to list the possible option. It could possibly take 45s for first three characters . 


Additional notes:
* this slowless can't be reproduce using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox. For the same steps, it take lesser than 5 seconds for Google Chrome to return the possible option match the user search
* this is tested with JIRA Service Desk 1.2.5 with JIRA 6.1.7

# define a request type in a customer portal
# add a field (for instance 'Description') and set a custom 'Display name' (for instance ('Any additional details you can provide?')
# go to the customer portal
# raise a request
# go to the JIRA issue
# it would be convenient, from a customer service team member point of view, to know the exact question the customer was asked next to this field. This could be done by adding display name next to the field name. In this case: {quote}*Description* (Any additional details you can provide?){quote}. Alternatively, it could be added in a tool tip.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-596].
  {panel}

We are using the Service Desk in JIRA ondemand. We use it to service customers with multiple contacts, phone numbers, equip under maintenance, etc.This data changes on a frequent basis.

Ideally we want to set up approx 'x' custom fields in the Service Desk for this data and we wish to import the data into these fields from an external DB, probably a CSV file. Is there a way to do this import without raising new tickets? (A plug-in like nFeed but for ondemand version)

The fields would be used as follows - When you select customer 'A', one or all of the 'x' custom fields appear with imported data.

Any help appreciated as the SErvice Desk is unusable for us without this feature.
fields.summary: Service Desk custom field datafill / import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-595].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
* Enable JIRA's Public mode
* Access the Service Desk customer portal Login page

*Expected results*
* User should be able to create his own user via a "Sign up" link

*Actual results*
* User doesn't have a link for signing up. Instead he gets a message telling him to talk to the JIRA administrator to create a user


{panel:bgColor=#FFFFCE}h6.Update - open signup in Service Desk 2.0 
This ticket was closed as Service Desk couldn't work with JIRA's public signup. Please note, though, that as of Service Desk 2.0, it's possible to enable public signup for specific Service Desks - in those cases, the _Sign up for an account_ link will be displayed in the Service Desk's login page. More details can be found in the documentation: [Configuring public signup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Configuring+public+signup].
{panel}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-584].
  {panel}

h4. Summary

The "Ready for Support" transition has been renamed to "Respond to Support". This is due to a simplification of the default Service Desk workflow, but unfortunately affects any existing workflow. The underlying cause is that the "jira.i18n.title" value "sd.workflow.itsupport.transition.waitsup.title" was used for the "Ready for Support" step, but has been re-used for "Respond to Support".

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# While JIRA Service Desk 1.2.5 or below is installed, create a new service desk project, and use the default workflow
# Upgrade to version 1.2.6.1 or above
# Create a service desk request
# Observe that the transition is now called "Respond to Support" while the issue is in "Waiting for Triage" state.
fields.summary: "Ready for Support" transition renamed to "Respond to Support" in "Waiting for Triage" status

There should be keyboard shortcuts for quick navigation in the Service Desk queues view.

j and k to go to next/previous issue would be killer(and would also be great while viewing issues as well), but it would be even better to have g then s go to the top of the current service desk or g then q to go back to your current queue or something similar.

Is there a roadmap for adding some Service Desk specific keyboard shortcuts or recommended plugins to bring this functionality?
{panel:title=Update as of 31 Mar 2017}
Hello Cloud customers,

Great news - queue keyboard shortcuts is now available on cloud! The following are implemented:
 * j - focus next issue
 * k - focus previous issue
 * o or Enter - open the issue

On behalf of the JSD team I want to thank all of you for your comments and feedback.

— JIRA Service Desk Team
{panel}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-558].
  {panel}

h3.Symptoms
Submitting an issue through service desk fails. The create button gets disabled and re-enabled without proceeding to the issue page.

No feedback is provided to the user on the successful creation of the issue.
No warning is displayed indicating a hidden field will affect the issue creation process

h3.How to reproduce
# Open customer portal
# Click any request type, e.g. "Get IT Help"
# Fill in request form
# Click "Create"
# Hour glass appears and button is greyed out...
# After a while, the "Create" button is re-enabled.
# The request is created and can be seen inside JIRA.
# The request cannot be seen by the customer under Customer Portal > Requests.

Also, on Chrome Developer Tool, the create AJAX call triggers a 404 Not Found page:
Example:
{code}https://<instance>/servicedesk/customer/portal/<servicedesk_id>/create/<form_id>{code}

h3.Diagnosis
* The problem occurs when the 'Customer Request Type' field is hidden in the issue type field configuration.
* The root cause is the default Issue Type's Field Configuration has  'Customer Request Type' hidden. On creating a new service desk, the default field configuration is cloned.
* This also happens if the issue type is not properly assigned to the 'Customer Request Type' field in the field context.

h3.How to resolve
h4.Resolving existing service desks
# Browse to each project where Service Desk is enabled.
# Browse to the project 'Administration' page.
# Browse to 'Issue Types' from the left-side menu.
# Browse to the 'Field Configuration' specified for the issue type.
# Scroll down to the 'Customer Request Type' field.
# If it is hidden, press the 'Show' link to make it visible,
# Repeat for each different Field Configuration on the Issue Types page.

h4.Resolving the default field configuration
This will prevent service desks created in the future from being affected with the same problem.
# Browse to JIRA Administration > Issues > Field Configuration
# The default field configuration is the one without an 'Edit' button. Browse to the default field configuration.
# Scroll down to field 'Customer Request Type' and 'Show' the field.
fields.summary: Submitting an issue through service desk when 'Customer Issue Type' field is hidden should not be allowed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-557].
  {panel}

Greetings,

It is possible to have a revision number for screens and workflows in the event that they get altered?  We ran into a scenario where a workflow (that was shared by multiple departments) was altered in a way that ended up breaking other group's workflows.  The steps it took to recover everything were painful and long, a way to track and revert such alterations would really be helpful.

Thank you,
-rob
fields.summary: Revision numbers when screens and workflows have been altered.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-555].
  {panel}

JIRA version - JIRA v6.2.3
Service Desk version - JIRA Service Desk v1.2.5
Auth is LDAP
OS is CentOS 6.4

The problem is not related to raising tickets, it's to do with the way the notifications come through to members of the service desk project. 

All of our usernames are lowercase, following the firstname.lastname format.

Notifications from some people come through as 'Anonymous (JIRA)' and for others, they come through fine as Firstname Lastname (JIRA). In both cases, the actual issue gets raised correctly, with the correct Reporter field correctly set.

It seems to be totally random, as all the users seem identical in terms of their group memberships and setup.
fields.summary: Service Desk notifications coming through from Anonymous (JIRA)

Would like to see the results of implementing several new services in terms of how it affects our ability to resolve issues on the first customer contact.  For example:

Confluence KB implementation
Changes in information capture on the customer portals
Trainign and education improvements.

Currently, either this is impossible or it is next to impossible to find as I have looked in many places but ther seems to be no information on it.
